bibl.title: Amheida I: Ostraka from Trimithis. Volume 1. Texts from the 2004-2007 Seasons, with contributions by Raffaella Cribiore and Günter Vittmann
bibl.note: tabl., fac-sim., 11 figg. n./bl. et coul.

O. Trim. I, 1-454. - Present 454 inscribed [in Greek and Demotic] pottery fragments, or ostraka, found during NYU's excavations at Amheida in the western desert of Egypt. The majority date to the Late Roman period (3rd to 4th century AD). - Preface. - Introduction and figures [in part., archaeological context]. - Texts, translations and commentaries. - Indices. Notes.
bibl.seg: Bagnall Roger S. and Giovanni R. Ruffini, with contributions by Raffaella Cribiore and Günter Vittmann, Amheida I: Ostraka from Trimithis. Volume 1. Texts from the 2004-2007 Seasons.

New York, New York University Press, 2012, 4°, 261 pp., tabl., fac-sim., 11 figg. n./bl. et coul. ISBN 978-0-8147-4526-7. $55. [Également accessible en ligne, en téléchargement gratuit: < http://dlib.nyu.edu/awdl/isaw/amheida-i-otrim-1/ >.]

O. Trim. I, 1-454. - Present 454 inscribed [in Greek and Demotic] pottery fragments, or ostraka, found during NYU's excavations at Amheida in the western desert of Egypt. The majority date to the Late Roman period (3rd to 4th century AD). - Preface. - Introduction and figures [in part., archaeological context]. - Texts, translations and commentaries. - Indices. Notes.
